title: [LGBT Community appeased!]
body:
https://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/comic/varus/issue-1/

You can tick that box off now Riot.
Thats what this was all about right?

_"We have gay champs too, please don't sue us!"_

If you want to make a homosexual champ _(that isn't Vi or Taric or Ezreal)_, make one! embrace it! Wind that unique essence into the soul of that champ, theres so much potential there, like there was with Rakan/Xayah. Don't just pick an existing champ at random that has literally nothing to do with it and beat them with the gay stick to appease the keyboard warriors...

It's the same as putting the 'token' black man in a film so you cant be called racist. Theres no need, just make good characters and if being a minority enhances that champ, go for it! If not, don't force fit it.

Xayah/Rakan works so well because they were always going to be a couple. It worked amazingly because you made a new champ with that as their essence. The same concept would have failed miserably if you had just reworked TF and Eve to be the in-game couple.

You play Varus, he has been out for 5 years so we all know him and his cause pretty well, and has absolutely no quotes or any hints at all of ever being in any form of relationship _(heterosexual or otherwise)_, nor is there any mention of him having 3 personalities inside him _(which you'd think would somehow appear in his in-game flare...)_. and yet those are the things that he is supposedly literally all about? Infact when you play him, he's all about vengeance and death, which is pretty much the opposite to how the comic ended.

and now you cant rework him either to fit him to the story, because you've just made a new video about him that cements his current look, so there is no VU for him for a while yet.

What you've done is make a **really really cool** creation story, and applied it to a champ that has no need of it, and doesn't really suit it.
The _'willingly giving into corruption sacrificing yourself and your morals for a good cause'_ story was good, and it worked well for Varus.
You should have saved this love-loss story for a new Darkin or something else like that. It would have been so cool to see this story wound into the in-game essence of a champ, but now we don't get to see any of that because Varus's VO or character doesn't include any of it.

replies.body:
My initial reaction was 100%, wow, they are forcing Varus to be gay for no real reason. But then after a while to process it, and thinking "does it fit?", the answer is yes, because at no point is he considered any kind of sexuality, so giving him one is fine.

The only problem I have is that Varus is a 3 in 1 fusion... which was never hinted at.

My understanding of his old lore was, Varus defended the Darkin Bow from being stolen by Noxians (as shown in the new lore), then due to his village being destroyed and all his family killed, he releases the power in order to get vengeance on Noxus but is consumed by it.

Simple. Clean. Varus, The Arrow of Retribution.

What is he now? Varus, The Arrow of Multiple Personalities. I feel like if part 3 of the lore didn't exist and the video simply showed 3 becoming 1, that would have been fine. But showing him arguing inside himself, doesnt make much sense.

It was done in a pretty beautiful, tasteful way. The film clip especially is great at highlighting the love these two had for each other.

I don't think that means that varus is gay though, because varus is the darkin, with the two hunters fused into his body.

So he's 2/3rds gay?

Oh I agree it was a great story, and somehow it wouldn't have been as heartfelt if it was a girl and a guy (or even two girls for that matter).
But why Varus? It was a good story and a good champ, but they forcefitted the two.

It's like if they took someone like Kat and be like "oh yea but shes actually Shuriman and was adopted." Like.. there's no point changing her story for no reason to something that is and has never been relavent to her.

When you have a good idea Riot, make a new champ for it, don't be lazy and throw it at already established ones.

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=vjEhIAcs,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2017-12-01T07:40:44.329+0000)
>
> When you have a good idea Riot, make a new champ for it, don't be lazy and throw it at already established ones.

"When it isn't broken, don't fix it"


Someone forgot to tell Riot that....

We already had bi champs tho, Shaco and Ahri.

Years ago riot confirmed that shaco was into other guys.
And well Ahri's lore does say she targets Men, but I believe it also says she pretty much targets "Humans" in general.

My point is though, like ahri, you decide on her personality and characteristics in development, that's what makes a wel rounded champ.

You don't just have a champ out for 5 years with an already established personality and mission, then just be like "oh btw he's different now, and always has been."

It's a great story they have done, why not use it for a new champ?
wonder which champ they'll make have aspergers or something to appease the autism awareness movement?

I agree, would of been better as a new champ, and not changing an existing one. Also the way they handled it doesn't seem that new because its a bit similar to Kayn, but instead of two entities there is three. Also I feel attaching this love story and keeping both Valmar and Kai alive inside of the new Varus is weak. The theme of vengeance would be better portrayed if one of them had died for good.
It would be cool if one died for good, and the other was just like "fuck this cruel world!" And willingly gave himself to the Darkin just to see the world destroyed.

yeah, like I watch that trash...
Varus can be gay as a rainbow, idgaf.
All the lore on the world doesn't fix this broken ass reward system.
